flawed_nl_solution:
Luke started putting together, 1000 x 0.1 = <<1000*0.1=100>>100 pieces.
The next day, there were 1000-100 = <<1000-100=900>>900 pieces left.
Then he put together 900 * 0.2 = <<900*0.2=810>>810 pieces on the second day.
So there were 900 - 810 = <<900-810=90>>90 pieces left.
On the third day, he put together 90 * 0.3 = <<90*0.3=27>>27 pieces.
Therefore, Luke still has 90 - 27 = <<90-27=63>>63 pieces left to complete the puzzle.
#### 63

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 180, not 810. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
